text:
Q: How to run a function every day at a specific time in python? A:

Here is the Ursina code for flappy bird

import ursina is referred into a big error, copy this code to import it.

pip install ursina

This will allow to use it! Here is the rendered 3D flappy bird game

from ursina import *
import random

app = Ursina()

camera.orthographic = True
camera.fov = 20

# ---------------- SOUNDS ----------------
jump_sound = Audio('assets/jump.wav', autoplay=False)
hit_sound = Audio('assets/hit.wav', autoplay=False)
score_sound = Audio('assets/score.wav', autoplay=False)

# ---------------- BACKGROUND ----------------
background = Entity(
    model='quad',
    texture='assets/background.png',
    scale=(30, 15),
    z=1
)

# ---------------- VARIABLES ----------------
gravity = 25
jump_force = 9
velocity = 0
pipe_speed = 6
pipe_gap = 4
score = 0
game_running = True

# ---------------- UI ----------------
score_text = Text(text='0', position=(-0.85, 0.45), scale=3)

# ---------------- PLAYER ----------------
bird = Entity(
    model='quad',
    texture='assets/bird.png',
    scale=(1, 0.8),
    position=(-5, 0),
    collider='box'
)

# ---------------- GROUND ----------------
ground = Entity(
    model='quad',
    scale=(30, 2),
    y=-6,
    collider='box',
    visible=False
)

# ---------------- PIPES ----------------
pipes = []

def spawn_pipes():
    if not game_running:
        return

    y = random.uniform(-2, 3)

    bottom = Entity(
        model='quad',
        texture='assets/pipe.png',
        scale=(2, 10),
        position=(10, y - pipe_gap),
        collider='box'
    )

    top = Entity(
        model='quad',
        texture='assets/pipe.png',
        scale=(2, -10),
        position=(10, y + pipe_gap),
        collider='box'
    )

    bottom.passed = False
    pipes.extend([top, bottom])

invoke(spawn_pipes, delay=2, loop=True)

# ---------------- GAME LOOP ----------------
def update():
    global velocity, score, game_running

    if not game_running:
        return

    # Mobile-style gravity
    velocity -= gravity * time.dt
    bird.y += velocity * time.dt

    # Bird rotation (mobile feel)
    bird.rotation_z = clamp(velocity * 3, -30, 30)

    for pipe in pipes:
        pipe.x -= pipe_speed * time.dt

        # Score when passing pipes
        if pipe.x < bird.x and not getattr(pipe, 'passed', True):
            pipe.passed = True
            score += 0.5
            score_text.text = str(int(score))
            score_sound.play()

        if bird.intersects(pipe).hit:
            game_over()

        if pipe.x < -12:
            destroy(pipe)
            pipes.remove(pipe)

    if bird.intersects(ground).hit or bird.y < -5:
        game_over()

# ---------------- INPUT ----------------
def input(key):
    global velocity
    if key == 'space' and game_running:
        velocity = jump_force
        jump_sound.play()

# ---------------- GAME OVER ----------------
def game_over():
    global game_running
    game_running = False
    hit_sound.play()
    application.pause()

    Text(
        text='GAME OVER',
        scale=3,
        origin=(0,0),
        y=0.2,
        background=True
    )

    Button(
        text='RESTART',
        scale=(0.2, 0.1),
        y=-0.2,
        color=color.azure,
        on_click=restart_game
    )

# ---------------- RESTART ----------------
def restart_game():
    global velocity, score, game_running

    application.resume()
    game_running = True
    velocity = 0
    score = 0
    score_text.text = '0'
    bird.position = (-5, 0)
    bird.rotation_z = 0

    for pipe in pipes:
        destroy(pipe)
    pipes.clear()

app.run()
#And that's all!

And this is a code for Your 3D flappy bird!

Thank you!

Please like me!

Q: Silent/Automated Homebrew Install A:

Use this environment variable to silence the Homebrew installer:

export NONINTERACTIVE=1

Q: PHP is not running through command line A: 
Open a terminal and type php -v to see the current version of php.

Determine the path for the wanted php version of mamp (YOUR VERSION ON YOUR COMPUTER!)

example : /Applications/MAMP/bin/php/php5.x.x/bin/php
Type in the terminal cd ~ to change the current directory (in your home)

Then, type nano .bash_profile to open an editor in your terminal

Type alias php='/Applications/MAMP/bin/php/php5.x.x/bin/php', don't forget to replace the php version

Now, you must save the file so press CTRL+X, then type Y and finally type Enter

You must restart (stop && start || close && open) your terminal and type php -v again

You now use the php version of mamp when you type php in the terminal

Q: Deserialize XML List into FrozenSet A:

XmlSerializer (which dates from .NET 2) doesn't support such "newer" immutable collections. The exception message, while not entirely clear, is indicating that deserialization is failing because FrozenSet<T> lacks required methods to add and set items into collection.

For confirmation, see Serializing a class that implements the ICollection interface:

To be serialized, the class must include an Add method and an Item property (C# indexer).

FrozenSet<T> is also abstract; it's intended to be created by some factory method such as FrozenSet.Create(). Even if it had the required method and property, it couldn't be constructed directly by XmlSerializer.

The easiest workaround is to create a surrogate array property like so:

public class A
{
    [XmlArray("Foo")] // XmlArray indicates the collection should be serialized with an outer container element (here <Foo>) along with the inner item elements (here <int>)
    public int [] FooArray { get => Foo?.ToArray(); set => Foo = (value ?? Array.Empty<int>())?.ToFrozenSet(); }
    
    [XmlIgnore]
    public FrozenSet<int> Foo { get; set; }
}

Notes:

  • You need to use an array rather than a fully mutable collection such as HashSet<int> for your surrogate property for reasons explained in this answer to Cannot deserialize XML into a list using XML Deserializer.

  • Your collection was serialized with an outer container element <Foo> and a repeating sequence of inner item elements <i>. In such situations you need to use [XmlArray("Foo")] to specify the outer element name. (You can also use [XmlArrayItem(string itemName)] to specify the inner element name, however it isn't necessary here as the default is correct.)

    [XmlElement(ElementName = nameof(Foo))] indicates that the collection should be serialized as a repeating sequence of item elements (here named "Foo") without an outer container element, which causes the second InvalidOperationException noted in your question.

Demo fiddle here.

Q: 3D Earth globe on google maps API JS A:

Google Maps 3D globe is available now.

https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/3d/overview

But only in satellite image tiles not in roadmap.

Q: In R, how can I call a web service if I have WSDL description of it? (consume web service) A:

omegahat.org is not valid any more, but omegahat.net is and the software SSOAP is available for download. However, it is not possible to install this package with the R version 3.6.2.
